metadata.title: CVE-2016-1834 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the xmlStrncat function in libxml2 before2.9.4, as used in Apple iOS before 9.3.2, OS X before 10.11.5, tvOS before9.2.1, and watchOS before 2.2.1, allows remote attackers to executearbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) via acrafted XML document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1834` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1').
